description: A unique ID for each accident chemical record.
The unique ID for each accident record.
The identifying ID for a particular chemical released in an accident.
The amount of the substance released in the accident, in pounds, to two significant digits.
The percent weight of a chemical within a mixture released in an accident.
The number of listed flammable component chemicals for this chemical record.
The identifying CAS number for a chemical.
The type of chemical (T=toxic, F=flammable).
A unique ID for each flammable chemical record.
A unique ID for each accident chemical record.
The identifying ID for a particular flammable chemical released in an accident.
The unique ID for each RMP accident record.
The unique ID for each RMP submission.

Time at which the RMP accident began.
The NAICS industry or product type code for the process involved in the accident.
Approximate duration of accidental release in hours and minutes (HHHMM)
Indicates whether the accident was a gas release.
Indicates whether the accident was a liquid spill or evaporation.
Indicates whether the accident was a fire.
Indicates whether the accident was an explosion.
Indicates whether the accident was an uncontrolled or runaway reaction.
Indicates that the release source in the accident was a storage vessel.
Indicates that the release source in the accident was piping.
Indicates that the release source in the accident was a process vessel.
Indicates that the release source in the accident was a transfer hose.
Indicates that the release source in the accident was a valve.
Indicates that the release source in the accident was a pump.
Indicates that the release source in the accident was a joint.

The units in which the wind speed is expressed.
The wind direction at the time of the accident.
The ambient temperature at the scene of the accident, in degrees F.
The atmospheric stability class at the time of the accident.
Indicates whether there was precipitation at the time of the accident.
Indicates whether weather conditions at the time of the accident are unknown.
The number of on-site deaths of workers (employees and contract employees) due to the accident.
The number of on-site deaths of responders (e.g. fire department personnel) due to the accident.
The number of on-site deaths of the general public (e.g. visitors) due to the accident.
The number of workers (employees and contract employees) injured on-site due to the accident.
The number of responders (e.g. fire department personnel) injured due to the accident.
The number of the general public (e.g. visitors) injured on-site due to the accident.
The amount of property damage on-site, in dollars, due to the accident.
The number of people killed off-site due to the accident.
The number of off-site people who needed to be hospitalized because of the accident.
The number of off-site people who required medical treatment other than hospitalization due to the accident.
The number of off-site people who needed to be evacuated due to the accident.
The number of off-site people who needed to shelter in place due to the accident.
The amount of property damage off-site, in dollars, due to the accident.
Indicates whether fish or animal kills occured as a result of the accident.
Indicates whether defoliation occured as a result of the accident.
Indicates whether water contamination occured as a result of the accident.
Indicates whether soil contamination occured as a result of the accident.
Describes other environmental damage that occured as a result of the accident.
The type of event that initiated the accident.
Indicates whether equipment failure was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether human error was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether improper procedure was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether overpressurization was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether an upset condition was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether a by-pass condition was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether maintenance activity or inactivity was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether process design was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether unsuitable equipment was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether unusual weather was a contributing factor in the accident.
Indicates whether management error was a contributing factor in the accident.

A code that describes the kind of industrial activity or products made by the process.  Applies to a single process, not the facility as a whole.
The number of prevention program 2 records associated with this process NAICS.
The number of prevention program 3 records associated with this process NAICS.
A unique ID for each process.
A short descriptive label for each process. (optional)
The unique ID for each RMP submission.

A program level from 1-3 that reflects the process potential for public impacts and the level of effort needed to prevent accidents.  Processes with program level 1 have no public receptors in the worst-case circle.
Indicates whether this record contained Confidential Business Information (CBI) which has been erased by EPA from the public version of the data.
The number of chemical records associated with this process.
The number of NAICS code records associated with this process.
The number of chemical records associated with this process that have actual chemical identities.

The 5-digit Zip code in the mailing address of the owner or operator.

The name of the person responsible for RMP (part 68) implementation.
The title of the person responsible for RMP (part 68) implementation.
The name of the emergency contact person for the facility.
The title of the emergency contact person for the facility.

Contains, in order of preference, either the TRI Facility ID, the RCRIS Handler ID, or the CERCLIS Site ID.
A unique ID for each facility.
Indicates whether any process at the facility is covered by OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) of Highly Hazardous Chemicals Standard (29 CFR 1910.110).
Indicates whether facility has on-site more than a threshold planning quantity of a substance that is an extremely hazardous substance (EHS) defined in 40 CFR 355.
Indicates whether the facility is covered by Title V of the Clean Air Act.

description: ID for the facility under Title V of the Clean Air Act.

Agency that performed the last safety inspection of the facility.
Indicates whether the facility has received a Star or Merit Ranking under OSHA's Voluntary Protection Program. (optional)
Indicates whether RMP submission includes regulated substances which may not actually be present at the facility at the time the RMP is submitted.
Indicates the type of RMP submission.
A short label for the RMP submission.
Indicates whether there have been no accidents with off-site consequences in the last five years.
The foreign province in the mailing address of the owner or operator.

rtknet_field_name: Owner or Operator Foreign Zip Code
description: The foreign Zip code in the mailing address of the owner or operator.
The country in themailing address of the owner or operator.
Indicates whether the number of full-time employees has been claimed as CBI (confidential business information) and not released by EPA.
Date on which the RMP submission was checked by EPA.
Date on which EPA reported apparent errors in the RMP submission to the reporting facility.
Date on which EPA received the RMP submission from the reporting facility.
Indicates whether a graphics file was attached to the RMP submission.
Indicates whether an executive summary file was attached to the RMP submission.
Indicates whether certification statement that information in the RMP submission is correct was received.
The method or program through which the RMP submission was submitted.
Indicates whether CBI (confidential business information) claims have been substantiated.
Indicates whether EPA waived the requirement for electronic submission and let the facility submit on paper.
The date on which the RMP submission was postmarked.
Indicates whether the RMP submission appears to be complete.
The date on which this facility was deregistered from the RMP database (i.e., no longer has processes with potential off-site consequences).
The date on which the change in processes leading to deregistration actually occured.
The 5-year anniversary date after the facility's last full submission (i.e. when a new full submission is due.)
Indicates whether this record contained Confidential Business Information (CBI) which has been erased by EPA from the public version of the data.
Indicates, for a submission that contains CBI (confidential business information), whether an unsanitized version was submitted to EPA on paper.
The version number of the RMP Process software used by EPA to process the submission.

The longitude of the facility in decimal degrees, as taken from the Facility Registry System (FRS).

rtknet_field_name: Number of Potential Offsite Consequence Processes
description: The number of program 2 or 3 processes (i.e. those with potential off-site consequences) for this submission.

rtknet_field_name: Potential Offsite Consequence Toxic Amount Total (lbs)

rtknet_field_name: Potential Offsite Consequence Flammable Amount Total (lbs)

The total amount of RMP chemicals held in Program 2 or 3 processes (i.e. with potential off-site consequences).
